newsitem.title: ISRAEL: SOCCER-ISRAEL DUMP FIVE PLAYERS BEFORE CYPRUS GAME.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ISRAEL DUMP FIVE PLAYERS BEFORE CYPRUS GAME.

text.p: Israel coach Shlomo Scharf threw five players out of his 20-man squad on Tuesday for breaking a team curfew ahead of a World Cup qualifier against Cyprus.

The five -- four first-choice players and a former captain -- had gone to a movie without informing Scharf. They failed to return to the team's hotel north of Tel Aviv in time for the curfew, squad officials said.

The ousted first-team players are midfielders Haim Revivo of Spanish side Celta Vigo, Avi Nimni of Maccabi Tel Aviv, left-back Felix Halfon of Hapoel Tel Aviv and right-back David Amsalem of league leaders Betar Jerusalem.
The fifth man dumped from the squad, Nir Klinger, a former captain who plays for Maccabi Tel Aviv, had not been expected to start the match.
"We went to see a movie. It's a kind of therapy for us. We didn't go out to have a good time or to a disco. It looks like the situation is irreversible -- what a pity," Klinger told Israel Radio.
"It was all just a big misunderstanding, but perhaps our mistake was that we did not inform the coach," Nimni told the radio.
With Tottenham's Ronnie Rosenthal also ruled out after an injury during training on Monday, the Israel side will take on a drastic new look for Wednesday's tie in Tel Aviv.
Scharf immediately drafted in three new players -- Reuven Atar and Avishai Janno of Maccabi Haifa and Shai Holtzman of Hapoel Beersheba. All have previous international experience.
The revised starting lineup now looks to be more attacking in nature -- two strikers will be used -- as Israel strive to ensure a win.
Anything less will not be enough to maintain their quest to qualify for the World Cup finals ahead of either Bulgaria or Russia in European group five.
Israel - Rafi Cohen, Alon Harazi or Avishai Janno, Moshe Glam, Amir Shelah, Arik Bennado, Alon Hazan, Tal Banin (captain), Itzik Zohar, Eyal Berkovic, Eli Ohana, Alon Mizrahi
